technical-data.invention-title: Rehabilitationsrollstuhl, der mit der Anordnung für die absenkbare Fußplattenstütze vertikalisiert
Wheelchair for rehabilitation which verticalizes with the ensemble for footplate support which can be lowered
Chaise roulante pour réhabilitation verticale de l'ensemble du support de plaque de pied qui peut être abaissé

description.p: In the market for the rehabilitation of certain categories of disabled exist various solutions of wheelchairs which verticalize to allow the users to move to stand up position.

Various are the solutions for the layout of the frame and various are the uses of various actuators which by kinematisms of various types verticalize the seat, the backrest and move tuned with the verticalization the ensemble of the footplate support apparatus.
There are different solutions that obtain these performances using different systems of levers see e.g. US A 4623194.

The footplates from the position of wheelchair lowered in the normal setting of of seating to the position of verticalization must be subject to a lowering to allow the extension of the user legs which move from folded knee in seated position to extended knee in the stand up position.

It represent an inconvenient the fact that in the marketed wheelchairs the extension is performed by simple transfer as it can do in a telescopic system, which determine a sliding of the parts of the structure against the user with a sensitive discomfort.
Another inconvenient happens because in the verticalization the ensemble of footplates support continues to maintain the same distance regarding the frame and the same inclination.

A further inconvenient is due because the ensemble of footplates support is not removable regarding the frame without the possibility to reduce the encumbrance of the wheelchair when it isn't used or when it must be transported.

The purpose of the patent is to remedy to the inconvients above described that is perform the extension with the lowering of the ensemble of footplates support by a roto transfer of the upper part and that is simultaneously approach it to the frame with reduction of the slope so to allow during the extension with the lowering the accompany of the extension of the user legs without undress him.

Another purpose of this patent is to equip the ensemble of footplates support of a device for knee protection which from the seated position of the user during the verticalization lowers accompaning progressively the user's knees.
A further advantage is due to the fact that the ensemble of the footplates support is easily removable and the same easily applicable following the various needs.
All previously described is clarified examining the enclosed drawings.

The fig. 1 represents schematically the wheelchair in its normal lowered position equipped with actuator. Are evidenced the fram, equipped with wheels, seat, backrest, the ensemble of footplates support and the knees protection device.

The fig. 2 represents schematically the wheelchair of fig. 1 verticalized by the actuator. It is evidenced the performed extension downwards with the concomitant approach to the frame of the ensemble of footplates support.

The fig. 3 with reference to the fig. 1 with the wheelchair lowered shows detailed the ensemble of the footplates support with the upper part supported in coupling by kinematisms on the front part of the seat of the wheelchair and kept binded in a underneath area from the frame by a plate with hinging on the edges.

The fig. 4 with reference to the fig. 2 with the wheelchair verticalized shows detailed the ensemble of the footplates support with the upper part which in coupling by kinematisms with the front part of the seat has sustained the roto transfer with extension downwards and a concomitant approach to the frame.

The fig. 5 shows detailed the details of the coupling of the upper part of the ensemble of the footplates support with the front part of the seat and of the coupling of the beneath area which bind it to the frame.

It is evidenced that the upper part of the coupling is composed by an hinging and that in the area beneath the coupling composed of a plate with hingings at the edges, which keep it approched to the frame.

The fig. 6 is the representation corresponding to the fig. 5 where it is evidenced that the coupling of the plate with hingings at the withholding edges is made in such a way that it can be removed just next to the frame rotating upwards a schackle, hinged with the withholding plate, so to disangage its inlet from the pin jointed to the frame.

The fig. 7 correspond to the fig. 6 shows that the gap that is the division of the ensemble of the footplates support from the wheelchair is obtained pulling out the plug pin of the hinging of the upper part and operating a transfer of move away of the withholding plate from the pin jointed with the frame.

From the graphic representation of the figures it appears that the wheelchair composed of the frame 3 with the wheels 1,2 is verticalized by the actuator 13 which applied to the lower part 25 jointed to the seat 4 let it rotate around the hinging 21 verticalizing it while simultaneously the backrest 5 verticalize being hinged in 28 with the seat 4 and being connected by the lever 25 to the puller 27 jointed with the frame 3.
The rotation of the seat 4 around the pin 21 operate the schackle 14, hinged with it in 29 with a edge while with the edge it is hinged in 22 with the lever 15.
It is evidenced that while the arm of the lever 15 having fulcrum in 17 in the stirrup 16 jointed to the frame 3 connected in 22 with the schackle 14 is uprised, the opposed arm is lowered.

The lowering of such last arm 30 which is coupled for the hinging 10 with the upper edge 31 of the ensemble of the footplates support 6,11, 7 let this last one perform a roto transfer which determine its lowering.

Simultaneously the said lowering, because the ensemble of the footplates support 6,11,7 jointed by hinging in the point 11 to one edge of the plate 12, hinged this last one with the opposite edge with the pin 23 jointed to the stirrup 19 fixed to the frame 3 let the said plate 12 to perform a downwards rotation, determine to the ensemble 6,11,7 an approach to the frame 3.

To disassemble the ensemble footplates support 6,11,7 from the wheelchair it must be removed the plug pin 10, disangaging the location 31 of the upper part of the ensemble of the footplates support 6,11,7 from the location 30 of the lever 15, it must be uprised the schackle 19 disangaging its mouth from the pin 23 and after must be pulled out the edge forked part of the plate 12 from the pin 23.

During the verticalization of the seat 4 while it happens the roto transfer of the ensemble of the footplates support 6,11,7 due to the rotation of the lever 15, the consequent movement of rotation downwards of the plate 12 around the pin 23 loaded by the plate 18 jointed to the frame 3, determine a similar movement of the metal tube 20 jointed to the plate 12 and it happens the lowering and the moving away of the knee protections 9 assembled on the transverse supported by the poles 8 threaded in the said metal tube 20.
This movement of the knee protections is advantageous likewise the lowering of the footplates which accompany the extension of the user legs without undressing him.

After what previously explained it results the originality and the qualitative improvement of this patent is that during the verticalization of wheelchair perform the lowering of the footplates with the simultaneous approach to the frame of the ensemble of the footplates support, without creating undressing of the user, determining at the same time the movement of the knee protections in order that these last ones accompany also the moving of the user knees during the extension of his legs while he is assuming the stand up position.

claim.claim-text: Rollstuhl als Hilfsmittel mit einer Aufstehfunktion, wobei der Sitz (2) sich während des Aufrichtens um ein Gelenk am Rahmen (3) dreht und dadurch eine Umlenkung der Beinstützenkonstruktion (6,11,7) zur Absenkung auslöst, und dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass die Beinstützenkonstruktion (6,11,7) vom Rollstuhl abnehmbar ist, indem man den Schnapper (10), der die Beinstützenkonstruktion (6,11,7) oben mit dem einen Ende (30) des Hebels (15) mit dem Gelenk (17) am Rollstuhlrahmen (3) verbunden verbindet löst, und indem man die Platte (12) an der Beinstützenkonstruktion (6,11,7) vom Rahmen (3) abzieht, indem man die Hakenfalle (19) an der Platte (12) nach oben vom Stift (23) befestigt am Rollstuhlrahmen (3) abhebt.

Rollstuhl als Hilfsmittel mit einer Aufstehfunktion mit einer Beinstützenkonstruktion wie unter Anspruch 1 bezeichnet und gekennzeichnet dadurch, dass die Drehumlenkung beschrieben durch den Sitz (2) am oberen Ende (31) der Beinstützenkonstruktion (6,11,7) ausgeführt wird, indem der Bügel (14) an einer Seite (29) mit der Vorderseite des Sitze (2) und mit dem Hebel (15) mit dem Gelenk (17) an dem Endstück (16) mit dem Rahmen (3) verbunden ist und der Letztgenannte (15) am Ende des Arms (22) an der freien Seite des Bügels (14) über das gegenüberliegende Ende (30) mit dem oberen Teil (31) der Beinstützenkonstruktion (6,11,7) verbunden ist.

Rollstuhl als Hilfsmittel mit einer Aufstehfunktion mit einer Beinstützenkonstruktion , die sich absenkt, wie unter Anspruch 1 und 2 bezeichnet und charakterisiert dadurch, dass die sich Beinstützenkonstruktion (6,11,7) während des Aufrichtens und der Drehumlenkung dem Rollstuhlrahmen (3) annähert, indem sich das Gelenk (11) der Beinstütze (6,11,7) absenkt, was sich unterhalb der Spitze der Platte (12) befindet, die mit Stift (23) verbunden, die Drehung erlaubt.

Rollstuhl als Hilfsmittel mit einer Aufstehfunktion mit einer Beinstützenkonstruktion wie unter einem oder mehr der vorausgegangenen Ansprüche beschrieben und charakterisiert dadurch, dass die Knieschützer während der Aufrichtung des Rollstuhls der Bewegung der Platte (12), die sich nach unten bewegt, unterworfen sind, wobei sie von einem Rahmen (20,8), der sie mit der Platte (12) verbindet, gehalten werden.

Wheelchair for the rehabilitation which verticalizes whereby the seating (2) rotating around the hinging which couple it to the frame (3) while verticalizing it determines a roto transfer of the ensemble of the footplates support (6,11,7) lowering it, characterized by the fact that the ensemble of the footplates support (6,11,7) is removable from the wheelchair pulling out a hinging plug pin (10) between the ensemble of the footplates support (6,11,7) and the edge (30) of the lever (15) having fulcrum (17) on the frame (3) and disengaging the witholding plate (12) of the ensemble of the footplates support (6,11,7) from the frame (3) rotating upwards the schackle (19) hinged with the said withholding plate (12) pulling out its mouth from the pin (23) hinged to the frame (3).

Wheelchair for the rehabilitation which verticalizes with the ensemble of the footplates support following claim 1 characterized by the fact that the roto transfer determined by the seat (2) to the upper part (31) of the ensemble of the footplates support (6,11,7) is performed by the kinematism composed of a schackle (14) with a edge (29) hinged to the front part of the seat (2) and by a lever (15) having fulcrum (17) on an appendix (16) jointed to the frame (3) connected this last one (15) to the edge of an arm (22) to the free edge of the schackle (14) and with the edge of the arm (30) opposed to the upper part (31) of the ensemble of the footplates support (6,11,7).

Wheelchair for the rehabilitation which verticalizes with the ensemble of the footplates support which can be lowered following the claim 1 or 2 characterized by the fact that the ensemble of the footplates support (6,11,7) while it is roto transferred lowering, is also approached to the frame (3) for the lowering of the hinging (11) of the same ensemble footplates support (6,11,7) placed in an area beneath the top with the plate (12) which connect the pin (23) to the frame (3) letting it rotate.

5) Wheelchair for the rehabilitation which verticalizes with the ensemble of the footplates support following one or more of the previous claims characterized by the fact that the knee protections during the verticatization of the wheelchair are subject to the moving of the withholding plate (12) which rotates downwards, being the framing (20,8) which support them connected to the said plate (12).

Fauteuil roulant pour la rehabilitation qui verticalise où le siège(2) tournant autour de l'articulation qui le couple au châssis (3) quand il verticalise il détermine un transfer rotatif du support repose pieds (6,11,7) l'abaissant, caractérisé par le fait que l'ensemble du support repose pieds (6,11,7) est amovible du fauteuil roulant en tirant sur une tige de bouchon d'artic'lation (10) entre l'ensemble du support repose pieds (6,11,7) et le bord (30) du levier (15) ayant pivot (17) sur le châssis (3) et désengageant la plaque de retenue (12) de l'ensemble du support repose pieds (6,11,7) du châssis (3) tournant vers le haut le poignée (19) articulé avec la dite plaque de retenue (12) retirant son embouchure de la broche (23) articulé au châssis (3).

Fauteuil roulant pour la réhabilitation qui verticalise avec l'ensemble du support repose pieds suivant la réclamation 1 caractérisé par le fait que le transfer rotatif determine par le siège (2) à la partie supérieure (31) de l'ensemble du support repose pieds (6,11,7) est effectué par le cinématique compose par une poignée (14) avec un bord (29) articulé à la partie frontale du siège (2) et par un levier (15) ayant pivot (17) sur une appendice (16) jointe au châssis (3) engagé ce dernier (15) au bord d'un bras (22) au bord libre du poignée (14) et avec le bord du bras (30) opposé à la partie supérieure (31) de l'ensemble du support repose pieds (6,11,7).

Fauteuil roulant pour la rehabilitation qui verticalise avec l'ensemble du support repose pieds qui peût être abaissé suivant les reclamations 1 ou 2 caractérisé par le fait que l'ensemble du support repose pieds (6,11,7) alors qu'il est transféré roto abaissant, il est aussi approché au châssis (3) pour l'abaissement de charnière (11) du même ensemble support repose pieds (6,11,7) déplacé dans une position sous le haut avec la plaque (12) qui branche le pivot (23) au châssis (3) le faisant tourner.

Fauteuil roulant pour la rehabilitation qui verticalise avec l'ensemble du support repose pieds suivant une ou plus des précédentes reclamations caractérisé par le fait que les protections genoux pendant la verticalisation du fauteuil roulant sont sujet au mouvement de la plaque de retenue (12) qui tourne vers le bas, étant le châssis (20,8) qui les supportes lié à la dite plaque (12).
